Trial_Design.evidence: Trauma patients at 12 level 1 North American trauma centers were randomized based on transfusion ratios as described in the PROPPR trial.

Participants.evidence: Trauma patients at 12 level 1 North American trauma centers

Intervention.evidence: comparing DCL versus definitive surgical management (DSM)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomized based on transfusion ratios as described in the PROPPR trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: 329 patients underwent emergent laparotomy: 213 DCL (65%) and 116 DSM (35%).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 329 patients underwent emergent laparotomy: 213 DCL (65%) and 116 DSM (35%).

Result_Outcome.evidence: 24-hour mortality was 19% with DCL versus 4% (p<0.001); 30-day mortality was 28% with DCL versus 19% (p<0.001).

Harms.evidence: Sepsis and VAP occurred more frequently with DCL (p<0.05).
